definition: to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: You have to Think Big, Build Small.
sentences.chinese: 你必須高瞻遠矚，興建小型。

sentences.english: When it comes to Western tech companies, Google is unmistakably ahead of the curve.
sentences.chinese: 提到西方科技公司，谷歌毋庸置疑高瞻遠矚。

sentences.english: They were right, and their vision set the pattern for an entire industry.
sentences.chinese: 他們是對的，其高瞻遠矚爲整個業界樹立了楷模。

sentences.english: Benitez, though, isn't looking too far ahead at this stage.
sentences.chinese: 貝尼特斯並不在這個時候高瞻遠矚。

sentences.english: Only creative leaders who are visionary and empathetic will succeed.
sentences.chinese: 只有高瞻遠矚感覺敏銳的人才能成功。

sentences.english: Forward-thinking companies are already stepping up to address the challenge.
sentences.chinese: 一些高瞻遠矚的公司已經開始接受這一挑戰。

definition: to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering/hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity
to follow through/to carry through to the end
(abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
